title: Integrated Education on Digital Citizenship and Religious Moderation

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital literacy, online learning platform experience, and general understanding of religious diversity
context.additional_context: A blended learning approach combining flipped learning and project-based learning (PjBL), integrating asynchronous video lectures with face-to-face workshops. Practical tasks are conducted using social media platforms (e.g., Instagram).

learning_goals: Explain the connection between the three core elements of digital citizenship (ethics, literacy, security) and the value of religious moderation.
Critically analyze cases of religious extremism in online environments and propose alternatives.
Plan and produce a digital campaign (infographics, posters, etc.) on religious inclusivity through project-based learning (PjBL).

On asynchronous learning platforms (Padlet, Google Classroom), learners collaborate with peers from ≥3 cultural backgrounds to develop communication strategies resolving 2 conflict cases from face-to-face discussions. They execute strategies meeting ≥4 of 5 peer evaluation rubric items

resources: Virtual accounts for social media campaign management

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
